instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3209 lio board issue
threads.message:
so the lio board is acting weird when i hook up a power source i get no light, when i place my thumb on the u6900 and u6901 chip area i get a pulsing dim green light. if i keep my thumb on there and connect it to the board i will get a constant voltage flow and board shows signs of life (fan spin even after removing my thumb. once i unplug the charger and reconnect it will no longer power up until i disconnect the lio board and repeat the process with my thumb.

what may be causing this?

threads.title: 820-3209 lio board issue
threads.message: Check the usual, ACOK present, known good IO board+cable, PPBUS, 3V42?
